title: 108_s266
content: The Act titled "Antiterrorism Intelligence Distribution Act of 2003" allows state and local government personnel access to classified information for terrorist attack preparation and response. The Act aims to ensure state and local government personnel, including law enforcement and first responders, receive security clearances for access to classified information to prepare for and respond to terrorist attacks. The Department of Homeland Security is responsible for coordinating these efforts. The Act aims to ensure state and local government officials have access to classified information for the health and safety of citizens. The Office will identify appropriate officials at the state and political subdivision levels for this purpose. The Office will ensure adequate representation among personnel from various agencies and regions within each State. The term 'State' includes the several States and the District of Columbia. Amendments are made to the responsibilities of the Director of Central Intelligence under the National Security Act of 1947. The responsibilities of the Secretary of Homeland Security are amended to include sharing information with designated State and local government officials. This must be done within 180 days of the enactment of the Act. The Secretary of Homeland Security must ensure that designated State and local government officials receive security clearances and training to access national intelligence. This must be done within 180 days of the Act's enactment. The Secretary of Homeland Security must provide technology and facilities for the secure transmittal of classified information to State and local government officials designated to receive national intelligence. This must be done in consultation with the Director of Central Intelligence and the Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation.
